item.title: Binomial Distribution
item.description: We introduce the binomial distribution with a simple example: imagine you have a coin with two sides: Heads and Tails. We don’t know if the coin is fair, but we can try to do an experiment to see if it s fair. We flip it many times and if it is a fair coin, we should see the same number of Heads and Tails. Let’s say we have flipped it 10 times and got the following sequence: s = {H,T,T,T,H,H,T,H,T,T}.
